intro: Eupatorium decemflorum, commonly known as the ten-flowered thoroughwort, is a perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady woodlands and along streambanks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough, hairy texture. Eupatorium decemflorum is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local wildlife.
